So i get bored here...and the weak drinks arent really helping the vibe...so unless you roll here with 10+ friends to make it into a happenin' partaay...this bar is just a stop over.

but if you're looking for a chill night...you'll be sure to stay awhile.

p.s. CASH ONLY!
author: Gladys D.

description: Savoy Tivoli has a very laid back environment which I loved. There are two bars, 3 pool tables, and a photo booth (which was out of order at the time). Typical bar with a disgusting bathroom, but we enjoyed our stay so much that we didn't end up checking out other bars around the area. This is certainly not the greatest bar I've ever been to, but I still had a great time.
author: Kylie H.

description:
Last night was the second time I have been here.  I am drawn to it in comparison with the other extremely loud, so crowded you cannot move type north beach bars.  I am also drawn to any place (and there aren't many) that have a foosball table and a photobooth.  

Yet, I just cannot make it worth it.  The foosball table is the utmost crappiest one I have ever played on, that rips you off every time ($1 for 5, sometimes 6 balls).  My friend bought the first round ($65 for 4 beers and 4 shots of tequila!).  I completely forgot what a ripoff this place is when I went to the beer for a corona and change for foosball.  $6.20 for a Corona!  I asked the guy next to me if we were in the bahama's or something.  
This is not NYC, it is an old bar with a little charm that makes you wanna piss your pants to avoid the stomach curdling stench of an extremely backed up septic system.  It is not worth the attitude from bartenders, overpriced drinks that are short on liquor, and stench.  And they only take cash.  Makes you wonder why they are so greedily overpriced when they spare basic overhead costs at every angle.
Sorry Savoy, people need a true review.
author: Margaret D.

description:
I've met up with friends here numerous times, it's one of their local hangouts.  Love the indoor-outdoor atmosphere, the option to play pool, the good drinks, and the seemingly always free table.  

As for the crowd, lots of eye candy but so far not much substance.  Brings back a tinge of highschool insecurities.
author: Emily M.

description:
Laid back and not too crowded on a Friday night?  My boyfriend's dream bar.  

There are 3 rooms here, a main open patio type room ( where smokers were able to sit, drink and smoke all at the same time) , main room with 2 pool tables and then another room with bar set up and tables.  It was busy and almost every seat was occupied, yet it was spacious enough where you never got that clustered feeling in there.  

We had about 15 of us in our group and I will say that everyone had a great time here.  We drank, sat at tables and played pool. Not much else to say.  The crowd was diverse, and not too frat boy-ish, the drinks were strong and not too expensive, the staff was friendly and knew how to do their job.  

Nothing sensational but nothing bad either.  Good time for all.
author: Denise B.

description:
The Savoy is top of my list as one of the most beautiful and unique bars in The City. It has always been a great place to hang out- with plenty of seating, pool tables, free jukebox and a open patio area that looks out onto Grant Ave. Great service from friendly and polite (cute too) bartenders, and too many drink specials to count. 

Last night we went to the Savoy, (myself and a bunch of friends) and we started the night with $2 shots of Fernet, then kicked back with some delicious Margaritas (only $4 everyday wtf?). I also had a couple of delicious (and reasonably priced) cocktails from the list. Beer has come down in price here recently too, so the place is staying full into the early morning with a diverse crowd of peeps, but it was chill and a good night was had by all!

It is cash only, so make sure you bring a stash, and your dancing shoes, as there is a dancefloor in the cocktail bar.
author: Grace M.

description:
Weak drinks...but their outdoor patio is great on a warm day.

**UPDATE**
Had to give credit where credit is due...Savoy Tivoli has live jazz every Saturday afternoon. Great band, really entertaining...and the bartender made us fabulous hot toddies! Seeing "Big Money in Jazz" at Savoy Tivoli could become tradition...
author: Brianne K.

description:
Me, exposed:  So my friends and I go to S-T one night, one girl is visiting from out of town.  Some travelers from a local hostel come in, and my visiting friend starts to hit on him.  By the end of the conversation, he pokes her in the stomach and says "What doyou have a pillow under your stomach?".   That was kind of fucked up so she punched him in the arm. Part two of the story, I think a guy is cute, he comes sits next to me, he asks me where I'm from, and I say Philly.  He goes off on this tyrade about how Phillies fans were so mean to barry bonds when the giants were in philadelphia.  man, what a loser.   Why so lame??  i love this place though for randomshit like this.  there's some pool tables and dart boards, although i may be wrong, and maybe i was too drunk.

You don't have to get dressed up
You can smoke cigarettes on their patio
It's random
author: Lindsay T.

description:
They only take cash, which is the only reason I wont give them a five star.

We went out for some North Beach fun with a group of old friends, and some new.  I liked that there were some places where you can sit and hang out, and other areas that were much louder where you can dance etc.

They are indiscriminate and even let the 22 year old crack head kids on e join the fun!  Woo hoo for all round good fun at the Savoy!
author: Jenni B.

description: I can't speak for other days and evenings at the Savoy Tivoli, but some tasty cocktails, friendly service and excellent live jazz on a Saturday afternoon really hits the spot.
author: Ziad E.

description:
A little too much like Los Angeles.
People looking to be seen but not seen looking.
Attractive crowd (some days the women more than the men, other days the complete opposite), semi-trendy but nothing super unique.
If the drinks were a little less expensive it would be a great set up to a night out dancing/clubbing.  I've met a couple of nice girls here but I just brought them dancing somewhere nearby.
(rare) large smoking area without having to be in an alley or under a fire escape.  I don't smoke but I see this as a big plus for California's semi-ostracized smoking contingent.
If you are willing to just walk up to a stranger and try your luck, this is a fun place.  If you need enough beer to drown a mule team for this task, try Magnet or Grant and Green down the street.  The saving quality of the Savoy: it's within walking distance of dozens of bars so if it you get there and it's less exiting than you hoped,  you can just go somewhere else.
author: Mike V.

description:
On a City adventure, our ears were drawn to the Dixieland-style jazz wafting from Savoy Tivoli on Saturday afternoon.

The beers are a bit more expensive, but worth every drop to relax patio-side kickin' back to these toe tappin' tunes.

Live jazz on Saturdays starting at 3pm.  Check it out.

PS:  That afternoon, they also had a silent film going on their plasma ~ something I hadn't seen in eons.  They also have a photo booth, pool tables & a juke box. A one stop shop full of entertainment.
author: Cathy K.

description:
Cash only and expensive.  Yet, I'm drawn to it again and again.  I do love the foosball table and occasionally play pool.  

I did like that the bartender let me buy a bottle of wine with 4 glasses instead of buying 8 mini-glasses.
author: Taylor S.

description:
Of all the Grant Ave bars, I like Savoy-Tivoli the most. It's a nice seemingly relaxed atmosphere most of the time. people complain about the frat-boy element, but it's nowhere near as bad as some of the other places in the area.

I particularly like the "patio" area on a nice warm evening.
author: Bernie L.

description:
Savoy is the closest bar to my house, literally one block away. So why do I only get in there for a beer once or twice a month? They serve their beer in 14 oz. glasses but they still cost $5 each. The tables are set up in a way that people can't seem to figure out, thus meaning that i get bumped at least 10 times throughout a single beer. 

I went to Savoy one Saturday afternoon and they had some great live jazz playing. The crowd was mellow and the patio was comfortable, even with a band taking up half of it. That one afternoon raised this review from 2 to 3 stars.
author: Katherine C.

description:
I'm really not into this place but had to come a second time because I was outnumbered!  Since I usually get to pick, it seemed only fair though.  The place is really big and roomy, and there are lots of tables to sit at with your friends, and one of the good things is that you can actually carry on a conversation at this place.  The is one (or two) pool tables and two bars, that I could see, and the bartenders were friendly, but again this just isn't my cup of tea.  Nothing really wrong with it though.  Oh, aside from the restrooms that is.  For such a big place, did you really need to have such a tiny restroom, and did it really need to reek of a Tijuana beach (oh you know what I'm talking about...)?

P.S.  Not big on the smoking bit either.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
I went here for the first time last night.
It was okay....
I liked the setting, North Beach is amazing in itself. I liked how it was more indoor/outdoor. Though at night I got pretty cold. 
It seems like it would be a really fun place to go if you wanted to play pool, and chill with your friends. 
CASH ONLY!! I was not happy about this, because I don't like to carry a lot of cash on me, especially in the city.
The bartender made me a 'key lime pie' which was a little too sour for my taste.
Great ambiance, don't know if I'll go back.....
author: Sherae H.

description:
So this is one of those places that makes me debate on whether or not to review it on Yelp for months on end. I've been here a good 9 or 10 times in the last year or so. The debate is that, I love the concept, but honestly the bartenders suuuuuckkkkk


Ok, suckage is not referring to their personalities or friendliness or anything. They are actually pretty awesome people. Very friendly, very attentive, very talkative. So they don't suck. As people. As bartenders, yes. The drinks may or may not have alcohol in them, and at 7-9 bucks a pop for an effing vodka tonic (more like tonic and ice), it aint fun.

Then again, the bar itself is really cool. There are a few pool tables, a jukebox, outdoor covered seating, and plenty of tables. There are two rooms and lots of opportunity for people watching. And its a historic bar which is always fun.

Really the best part is its proximity to Golden Boy pizza. So go here to chill and drink non-alcoholic :) drinks with friends, pretend to be drunk, and gorge on probably the best pizza in town :)
author: verna b.

description: Had a fabulous night here on friday night!!! It was great for my larger birthday party. Drinks were great and service was quick!! Love love love!!!
author: Lillian L.

description:
I live just down the street fro Savoy, so  I have spent many a friday night there, taking back pints to start off the night.  The door man is rad, though he is starting to recognize me because I always forget to go to the ATM before I get there (cash only).  The crowd  is definitely diverse (ranging from the Marina-type post college kids, to thirty-somethings looking to relive the glory days).  For all of that I give it three stars.

However, if you ever get a chance to stroll down Grant Ave. on a late saturday afternoon, you will experience why Savoy Tivoli gets a fourth star;  Their band (definitely  worth a quick stop for a drink, no matter what you are doing).
author: Korey A.

description:
Pros:

- Great location for a North Beach bar hop
- Patio is good alternative to other places nearby
- Better than average bar music

Cons:
-Bro/DB factor runs high here (I saw multiple popped collar, sideways hat, look-at-my-abs guys)
- Beer is served in smaller glasses (I think they were the same IKEA water glasses I have) and was $6!
- Cash only, which can be that added inconvenience when you're out with a group
author: C P.

description:
Ok.  You need to know where to go for what.  So this is what: They play live Jazz and there's pool tables.

I like to go here when I want to think and not be surrounded by too many people and at the same time not be at home.  I play pool - which if you don't, you'll probably be bored here.

Lol.  I just saw this girl's comment about it being a cash only place.  That's right.  It can be a pain sometimes...but because I'm a girl who usually goes out with chauvinistic men and they never let me pay for anything, I completely forgot. - Yeah that would suck.  Lol.  I feel bad for her now...Poor thing.  But - don't all people bring cash with them when going out?  No?  Yes, I agree that an evening mugging doesn't sound too enticing.  Oh well.  Nevermind.
author: Susan C.

description: I just love this old bar. I think it has so so much potential to be quite the hot spot. Im biased of course because i live very nearby so this is an easy convenient stop for me and I always love north beach gems. But the bar is giant. its got 2 serving bars. A huge outside patio that is covered so its warm but your smoker frineds can still puff away in a social non chilly surrounding. They play fun music, there 2 pool tables, fuse ball, a juke box and my personal fav, a photo booth! I mean it really is a cool spot. You're never packed like sardines, you can almost always  get a table for a group of friends. There's never a huge line to the rest room. It's pretty much got everything you can ask for in a fun bar. And yet, it still never seems to be like 'the' place to be. I will continue to come and drag my friends because i just love the place.
author: Audrey V.

description: I was pretty much already messed up when I got here and I was busy entertaining 2 very cute guys so I had my hands full. I don't remember much about it, but I remember I liked it. It was extremely easy to get more drinks because there's a big bar, not like I needed another drink, but I'm just sayin...
author: Lucky N.

description:
ok, so after the tequilla elite event, i was plastered. but instead of heading home and being in my bed within 15/20 minutes, i somehow ended up on a cable car and at this place. i didn't even drink and ended up just sitting there with a blank look on my face. but here's what i remember...

-the heat lamp under carlos was hot. very hot. how did you guys sit under that thing for an hour?
-apparently they confiscated the tecate's and tequilla from the event. how dare they!
-the group that didnt want us to smoke even though we were in the patio area, and blowing smoke out onto the street. but at least they didnt leave, because the girls were pretty dope.
-the nice bouncer, which prevents a 1-star review.

much better bars in the north beach area...
author: Andrew T.

description:
CASH ONLY!

It's a large bar, that takes CASH ONLY, with 4 pool tables and a foos ball table.  One side of the bar opens up to the street.  There isn't a dance floor, but you could make your own which doesn't really happen.

I've been here multiple times and it's a good place to hang with friends.  No cover so if you don't like it head down the street to the other bars.  If you get hungry go down to Green Street to Golden Boys or across the street to North Beach Pizza.  If pizza isn't your thing head to Columbus Street for Mexican, Cheese Steaks or whatever else is open late.
author: Po L.

description: I'm not crazy about this place (hate the cash only!) but I always find myself ending up here. Out of respect, it's a historic gem. Did you know that BBB started at the Savoy Tivoli before moving to Club Fugazi in the 1970's? Well now that I think more about it, that's pretty awesome. Being able to enjoy live music in the open air half of the bar on a weekend afternoon is unbeatable as well.
author: Margaux N.

description: The atmosphere here struck just the right chord with me...casual crowd; awesome, old-school lounge decor; friendly bartender.  There is plenty of space and we managed to snag a comfy spot.  I was really impressed with this bar until I got my drink.  The only place I've ever seen a smaller cocktail is at a casino, but at the casino at least they're free, whereas at this bar you get the pleasure of paying $6 for your itsy bitsy drink.  RIP. OFF.
author: Tracy S.

description: If you are looking for a great cocktail, come in when Kyle is working.  Extremely friendly and makes some amazing drinks!  I loved the atmosphere.  I recommend Friends of the People.  As Kyle would say, Do it.  :)
author: Jenn B.

description:
This is a wonderful place to go earlier in the day--say from 3pm to 7pm--when there are fewer people there. When it's crowded, it's too crowded, but that's usually after all the tourists and faux bohos finish their dinners. But for those of us who like our evening beferaves before dinner, this is a grand locale. The pool tables are average, but infrequently used during the abovementioned hours, so if you want to rack 'em up, you're sure to find a free table then.

On Saturday afternoons, a New Orleans-style jazz band, with the local notable Mal Sharpe on trombone (he of the "man on the street" interviews in the 1960s) add tremendously to the conviviality.
author: douglas s.

description:
The perfect place to go if you just want to sit down and have a no-thrills beer without having to fight about seats or have your eardrums popped by annoying music.

The lack of exterior walls in the section facing the street (a.k.a. the patio) also makes sure that you are kept somewhat cool hot summer nights.

Me like!
author: Pastor Z.

description: I have never written any bad reviews but we had a very bad experience in Savoy which made me write this review.. First of all, This place sucks big time.. If there is an option to give less than a star, i would give it.. They accept only cash and the bartender was so rude to us.. The bartender refused to serve us drinks saying that we didn't tip him enough even though we had tipped him more than enough.. I would never recommend this place to any one.
author: Cruiser C.

description: Yay. I really liked it here in the context of the all shook down festival... great performances and I really liked the space.
author: Best M.

description: Went out there with friends last friday. Pretty cool place to hang out though good luck finding a parking spot on friday. They have two pool tables and its more like a cool hang out place with friends or to bring a a date.
author: Kishor K.

description: Wow. This bar's crowd is REALLY not my thing....basically cram all the a**hole noveau riche ex-frat boys and the tube top wearing girls that love them into a random overly lit restaurant with too many misplaced tables and overpriced beers, and VOILA!, you have the Savoy.
author: Rachel W.

description: I've tried and tried again.  I just can't get used to the over-priced, weak drinks.  I'm a bourbon and ginger-ale kinda lady and it was like ginger-ale with a splash of bourbon.  Plus, I feel like I'm playing bumper cars all night.  It's saving grace would be the semi-outdoorsy feel and tables for groups (but that hinders mingling).
author: ellyk E.

description:
Ah North Beach, home to just about every thing you want to find, and a few things you don't.
   This bar USED to be a place I would drop by every night. I could look past the measured liquor, the cash-only bar, and the pay as you go drink policy. But now they've screwed up.
Not only did they kick out one of the city's nicest and most competent bartenders, but they have now banned smoking from the outdoor porch. One of the only bars with an open area. The atmosphere has changed.  No longer to I have a place to sit-down with a brew after a long day of work.  No longer do I have a cool spot to bring out-of-towners.
  I always thought that they would make more money by not using that damn jigger, but now the last thing that set this place apart has died. Such a shame.  This bar and its attributes was one of the last parts of the "old North Beach" that are disappearing every day.
So long Savoy Tivili.  We had a great time together but now it has ended.  It's not me, it's you.
author: Johnny F.

description: When I lived in North Beach, this was the place to recycle Eurotrash; a hyper-conscious crowd pretending not to look at each other while posing . . . and writers pretending to write while sneaking peeks.  It used to be great fun; someday I'll be bock (even if I sound silly with an Ahnold accent).
author: Carma K.

description: Because their redbull vodkas are expensive, the bartender recommended I buy one can of rebull then continue to order double shots of vodka.  It worked - I saved money and got hammered.  Mellow crowd, cash only.
author: Justy L.

description: I probably wouldn't want to deal with the out-of-town crowds on the weeknds, but I met some old & new friends here on a Thursday night and we had a great time at Happy Hour.  There was a sour apple sort of Kamikaze shot for $1.50 and I think the beers were around $4.50.  One of the bartenders kind of looks like Jeremy Piven but shorter and was rather friendly.
author: Tony P.

description: we headed on wards to find a bar, and into church key we went. and then this over powering smell of bleach killed the mood. went back outside and to the right to this place. huge. not many people for a saturday night.. lots of pool tables which was cool. not cool was my $6-7 beer. and the girls i were with, their drinks were in such tiny glasses! weird sketchy dudes hitting on and trying to dance with us (one fell out of his chair passed out drunk eventually, he got thrown out). the bathroom was utterly gross. seriously.. and the music was eh. so probably not heading back that way, unless we are desperate and just want to play some pool. ps- not a fan of cash only bars..
author: Abigail W.

description: Completely over priced drinks. The last time I was here I ordered a cran and vodka from John and when I asked for a little extra vodka he charged me $6 more! Whoa! My drink, which was crappy, cost me a total of $12. Oh hellz to the no! Definitely don't plan on returning here anytime soon.
author: Stephanie J.

description:
ahh, how my 25th bday blast last year began... My friends surprised me with a Pirate themed bday - I think the theme was an attempt to embarrass me, but when you can barely even remember the night, its hard to be embarrassed. 

They accommodated us very well - by saving the back room for us and storing our cake. AWESOME. Bartenders were so kind and fast - very strong, great priced drinks. 

This place can get packed and its ideal if you can snag a table on the  patio area to start your night. Savoy is always a great place to kick start a North Beach pub crawl!!
author: Jessica L.

description: I have only been there twice and both times I was very wasted. The first time I went there I had just moved to North Beach. I went with who is my roomate now she doesn't even remember going that time, all i remember is hardly anyone was there, i paid a a lot for 2 drinks and we ended up leaving not evening finishing our drinks. I really liked the set up of the bar and during the summer its great, it's very open. 2nd time we went with a group and we had a booth so that was fun.
author: Danielle K.

description: We had an after-work happy hour here once. Great patio-like seating, with more to offer (including PHOTO BOOTH OMG) inside. Drinks are too expensive, but prices are probably dictated by its location. It is North Beach, but $20 for a small cup of corked Cab and a Crown+Coke is steep. And, it being a work function, I opted against the photo booth. Maybe next time.
author: Tara R.

description: It's just ok.  This is one of those places that I never suggest, but end up going to because someone else wants to go there.  Because it's in NB, the parking situation is obscene.  It just doesn't really have any special pull, especially when there are so many other fun places to go in SF.
author: Nikki c.

description: Good Lord, why have I never been here before?! Great place to go on Saturday when they have live jazz! While I didn't stay too long, I'll be back for sure to play some pool (I'm pretty sure I saw a table in the back).
author: Elizabeth D.

description: Honestly, not bad for north beach. A very mixed crowd of undressed young women and older tourists. Good music, not to crowded, and it was easy to get a table. Not cheap ($8 for a stoli/sprite). Pool tables and a photo booth! Pretty creepy bouncers but one perk? No hipsters.
author: Halley B.

description: Three words: Saturdays three o'clock. Live jazz in the city, right next to grant's best boutiques. Priceless.
author: Bowie L.

description: Mike took me out there for some relaxing partying on my first Saturday here.  The drinks weren't expensive and Mike found plenty of women to talk to, so it's an decent place to pick up the ladies.
author: Nader A.

description: Adorable luminaries aside, I'd like to go back when there were more than 12 people in the place. The bartender was bored so he hassled us, but I was annoyed by it. Drinks were reasonable. A Tony Bennett doppelganger walked in as the bouncer. So funny. Heated patio was nice. Looks like it might get to be a cool, hopping place, but not at 8.
author: Angela H.

description: Here's what I like about Savoy. All the space. There's usually tons of room to move around and get a drink and do what you want. Here's what I don't like, the drinks are WAY small, the crowd is borderline obnoxious and it's kind of like a large frat house. Also I have a tendency to run into people I don't like here. So uh... three stars.
author: Cathy T.

description: If you must attend a meat market beause you're single, this is a good place.  Neither girls nor boys are too obvious that they're trying desperately to hook up.  Makes for a nice mix with those who really aren't trying, and are genuinely spending time with friends.  Beware of the bartender in the back - I asked him to recommend a good, "dry" cocktail, and he looked very perplexed and asked if I meant no alcohol.  Poor boy probably just got kicked out of a frat that had too many DRY parties.  Consider yourself warned.
author: Jeanne J.

description: Not a bad layout of the bar.  I enjoy the patio seating. Not many bars have a ton of seating room.  On the downside: horrible service, pricey drinks, and cash only.  I was there on my current birthday.  I asked nicely to this blonde tall female whitch bartender if she could give me a free drink for my bday.  It never hurts to ask.  She rudely said no.  "We don't give drinks to anyone"  Thats fine but I still want a drink and she walked away without taking my order.  She passed by me again without making eye contact and I left the bar right after that.
author: George S.

description: I really tied one on here last night. $2 shots of Jameson and Fernet-and fun on the dance floor! Most chilled, fun, relaxed bar in North Beach- an original hang-out spot for sure.
author: Wilbur J.

description: Sorry everyone I have nothing but good memories of this place - spotty, but good. Every time I've been here it's been on my way back to a friend's house at last call, totally plastered. Maybe that's why I like it, because you can be wasted and lounge on the outdoor-ish area, drink a beer, smoke cigarettes and fall asleep at the table. I needed to give a great review, even if it's just me!
author: Christine S.

description: When I'm looking to cause some trouble but don't feel like causing it on the dance floor, I head to Savoy.  The outside patio is my spot.  Grab your friends, grab a table, shoot the shit and flirt shamelessly.  Your friends will actually be able to hear what you're saying.  Whether they understand is entirely up to how much you've had to drink.  Unfortunately, it will take quite a few drinks at this place to get you to that point.  That's my biggest complaint - the drinks aren't as strong as I'd like for the price...and they don't take credit card.
author: Erin H.

description: For some odd reason my friends find a need to trek across the city from the lower haight and western adition to sit at this bar.  Why I ask?  I don't know but I find my self here more often than I would like.  I have to admit the smoking patio is bad ass, and the bartenders are always cool, and if I lived in NB i would probaly come here and not complain, but the fact that it cost over fifteen dollars to get home from just makes me not happy.
author: brian m.

description: Savoy was cool.  Bartenders were friendly and the drinks were okay.  The place was pretty packed, but the huge group I came with for a birthday just hung around the bar.  The crowd was not very diverse, but everyone acted and seemed cool.  Cool place to hang out and grab a few drinks.
author: Ruben P.

description: Lots of Coronas, baseball caps, loud guys and girls, a smoking patio, and of course, the requisite drunk dude falling backward in his chair.  It's not my usual scene, but somehow it worked.  Good place to hang out with a group of friends.  Kind of how I'd imagine spring break on South Padre Island, TX--only a little older and in a much better state all together.
author: M A N I K.

description: This place could be sweet.......BUT it is not. It looks so great, with all the indoor/outdoor feeling. It has lots of seating and then glass wall and one long bar. The bartenders were clowns, just serve me my drink and dont measure out shot by shot into my glass, just do the count thing and make it strong. The people there wanted it to be a club but it was not a club. I went on a sat night and I suggest you dont do the same. Over priced drinks, not great service, too crowded, no thanks.
author: peter v.

description: I've only ever ended up here in large groups full of pretty-close-to-being-traished people.  We have typically had a good time, but it's funny how your group will disperse as they meet all their other friends who are also hanging out here.  Very laid back, just the way I usually like it.
author: Kevin S.

description: On paper, this looks like it would one of the best chill bars in NB, but it has never panned out for me.  All of my friends seem to love this place, but i have never seen the charm that they have.  It is a big enough space, fairly fast bartenders...
author: Robert R.

description: omgggg this place has been around FOREVER!! good drinks, fun people&atmosphere, &also never had bad food here either.... good times!
author: Dth S.

description: I've been here twice, both Fridays nights.  Both nights, I started out somewhere else, and this is where I ended up.  Unfortunately for that, nothing awesome stands out in my mind about this bar, except that I had fun, and I went back again.  There is a pool table, which is always seems to be in use and the bar is cash only and pretty expensive for beer (at least $16 for 3) but everyone seems really nice and social.  It reminds me of a bar I frequented in college where I always knew who was going to be there.  Only difference, I just don't know that many people in the city yet.
author: Emily M.

description: I stumbled upon this place with a few friends and was absolutely amazed that a place in SF had as much room as this place- and it was still full! The atmosphere was really laid back and people seemed to be having a really great time whether they were sitting at the bar, playing pool, taking pictures in the photo-booth, or just relaxing with friends in the seating area. It was great- the music wasn't so loud that you couldn't talk- but it was just loud enough to "shake it" if you so desired. I Will surely be back!- Right- the only downfall, they measure their drinks... :(
author: Janell D.

description: I live down the street so I am probably a bit biased since the place to so convenient to me - but it's a great laid back bar. Friendly bartenders, nice open patio area, a couple of pool tables - perfect to start out or end a night. Gets packed during the weekend but its really quiet on weeknights. That said, it is very bridge and tunnel on weekend nights, and I would avoid it then.
author: Ossama A.

description: I find it pretty laid back, full of happy people, and well lit.  Got free beer here.
author: Wesley W.

description: An OK bar. I liked the outside patio and heat lamps, which was a nice change of pace, even on a chilly evening. However, drinks were pretty expensive for a dive-ish bar (even beers on tap) and the music inside was loud. I love loud music, but it was so ridiculous that I couldn't even think. Fortunately, moving to the patio saved my eardrums and pounding head.
author: Abigail R.

description: So i really like this place from experiences a couple years ago...although i did once sneak in my own liquor, and buy just juice, and was shocked when they charged me basically what a liquor drink costs anyway! Its nice if warm outside due to their basically outdoor seating, but a cash only bar, and kind of hole in the wall dingy, so good if with a group of people.
author: Danielle J.

description: I like the pseudo-outside seating, especially on a nice day after work. It can tend to get a little crowded on the weekends, so I prefer the weekdays. Decent drinks at average prices for North Beach...
author: Nicolas H.

description: Fun North Beach bar, can be hit or miss depending on what kind of crowd is there on any given night.  Pros:  lots of space, pool tables, good music and you are more likely than not to run into someone you know.
author: Katie P.

description:
Savoy is great on a warm summer (meaning October, or November) night--the patio area is a great compromise between being outdoors and a little chilly, and indoors and hot and claustrophobic.  Plus, you can light up out there, if you're in to that sort of thing.

I've been here many a time expressly to play pool, so that's obviously a draw for me and for many.  (In fact, I once even brought my parents here to shoot some billiards.  It was a Tuesday night.  It was the opposite of crowded.  We were the only three in the place.)

And it's been said before, but I'll say it again: Cash Only.
author: Hannah J.

description: I like the layout of this place.  It's spacious with several pool tables, foosball, and a juke box.  My main problem was that it was Saturday night in North Beach.  I would like to go back and try this place on a week night.  Well cocktails were $6.  $7 for Stohli
author: angela k.

description:
Hmmmm...  My friends like it.  I guess there are lots of "encounters" with so called hot people here.  It smells like Marina Area, or even to say...  Los Angeles to me.  So it's not really my thing. 

But it's worth checking out.  It gets crazy crowded over weekends.  I think weekdays are better for me because I don't like the weekends crowds.
author: T T.

description: Cool place to go in North Beach.  They have a smoking patio outside which is also good for people watching.
author: Joy W.

description:
I'm giving it 4 stars, but would demote it to 3 1/2 for the drinks they serve, but I'll get to that later.  I live just a few blocks away from Savoy and it seems like whenever my roommates and I go out in north beach, Savoy is the first place we head to, mainly because it has the pool tables in the corner.  You can walk in, grab a drink, (expensive drink and measured to perfection...pretty lame), throw your quarters on the table, and be on after a game, maybe 2.  Great place to go with a bigger group of friends because the place is so big with plenty of tables.

I feel like the crowd is a little hit and miss depending on what nights you go.  Been in there plenty of nights to see friends I haven't seen in years and have had an awesome time, but occasionally you'll find many a douchebag dudes in there just staring at you for no reason with this look on their face like they want you to just say something wrong so they can pretend to be angry.  Its pretty funny actually.  One time we played a couple random guys that were either shitcanned or were just of the super-douche breed.  They were probably around 25-27 years old, but had the mentality of a 12 year old.  First off, these guys looked like they were dressed to be in some club in LA,  were cheering for every missed shot we had, (I was pretty drunk so had a few of those), and looked at us like we were speaking a different language when we tried to just start up friendly conversation.  What made it worse was we actually lost to them because my friend and I were way too drunk to be making any shots.  I'm still pissed about it to this day.  But I digress...Overall, I still love this place because it close to home, has plenty of room, good company for the most part, and has pool tables.  Really can't ask for much more for a relaxing night.  O yea, and the security guard, Tim...is the man.
author: Mike F.

description:
The Savoy's a great little North Beach spot to hear some bands play, enjoy a glass of wine, and basically just people watch.
A good pick up spot to, according to some of my male friends.
author: Nicole R.

description:
My friends and I got together at North Beach on Saturday for dinner. Someone at the restaurant recommended that we go to Savoy Tivoli for drinks.

Let me counts the way, of my dislikes of Savoy Tivoli:

*It was so loud and crowded that you could not carry a conversation.

*They allow smoking in the Patio, so be prepared for second hand smoke.

*The drinks are expenses and they are so watered down, that your better off just getting a water it's cheaper.

*I have seen better restroom facilities in third world countries. For the amount of money that they charge for drinks, you would think that they would have money to address the restroom situation, it's disgusting. Maybe we can have a fundraiser "Save the Toilet at Savoy Tivoli'" 

* I could go on, but I will stop at this point, believe me after visiting Savoy Tivoli, you might need to have a drink to forget this terrible experience. 

I am giving  Savoy Tivoli one star, just because it's on Grant, a wonderful and fascinating street.
author: Fatima M.

description:
I live in North Beach and would LOVE to spend more time at Savoy because it is such a great lay out and a fun place with 3 pool tables, foosball, 2 bars, etc.  BUT - the drinks are WAAAAAAAAY too pricey - $7.00 for a TINY drink, and they USE A MEASURER TO MAKE SURE ITS JSUT ONE SHOT in a glass.  BOO.  Not for $7.  For $7 i can get a nice fat drink at any of the other places in North Beach.  I asked for a double since it was so small, and I got a gloass MUCH smaller than a pint glass and it was $14 - and had exactly 2 shots of vodka in it. 
If I got more for my money, I would be there all the time and spend $ there.  There is a reason the place is dead until midnight on fri and sat. - people go there when they are "finishing up the night" cause they only want to buy one drink there. Too bad......
author: Jewel S.

description:
Great locale for a Saturday afternoon to relax with a glass of wine and listen to live jazz.  

However, not a first choice for an evening out with friends.
author: Kathleen S.

description: oooooh, i almost forgot about this place! i used to live right down the street and loved this bar!!! if my apartment wasn't tidy enough to have everyone over for pre-drinks (before saturday night bar-hopping) we would all congregate here instead... a big patio area for many people! right on grant so its the perfect starting (or ending) spot if you're partying in north beach. cute, fun crowd too.
author: Michelle I.

description: Thats too bad.  I have lived in north beach off and for the last 4 years.  I have worked in bars around the world.  This was my first time here, I will try again, hopefully with a different bartender.  My friend and I ordered a Makers Mark Manhattan on the rocks. The girl working the bar was new I assumed because she asked her co- worker. He then went and told how to make it wrong! A Manhattan is 2oz of rye whiskey with 1/2 of sweet vermouth, few drops of bitters, and a cherry, if you want a little sweeter a splash of the cherry juice. The bald dude behind the bar said 1oz!!!! By his instructions she carefully measured one ounce of whiskey. Not wanting to argue with the bartender, my first time here and all, "Excuse, but I believe a manhattan calls for 2oz of whiskey" "well yeah, but its 2 to one we have to measure" what does that even mean? Your admitting your making the drink wrong and you would add 1oz of vermouth? For that and a shot of Fernet it was $16. I read some reviews about this place being cheap for drinks...not ours. The atmosphere is great, laid back, met some really cool people while there.
author: Allen M.

description: i think this place was a lot smaller the last time i went.   last night, it seemed like i was constantly entering a new room.  maybe i was just drunk.  it was the end of the line of a bar crawl so things are a little hazy.  i like that we were able to get seating by the pool tables and chill out for a bit, especially because it was a lot cooler in there than the other bars we'd been in that night.  temperature control is pretty important to me, i guess.
author: Seong P.

description: I love the Savoy.  You can't stay there all night or you'll go broke, but it's a great place to have a gin and tonic and listen to some excellent live jazz on a lazy afternoon.  Bartenders are always nice and friendly and there's virtually zero attitude in the place.  Feels like a southern speakeasy must have felt.
author: Steve S.

description:
We're S.F. Locals but have never been to this place before.
Anyway, we came for the music. Every Saturday from 3-6 pm, they
have had this wonderful Mal Sharpe Dixieland 5 or 6 piece band
performing which consisted of mostly elderly, extremely experienced and talented musicians! The music was terrific. Stick to the beer, and
$6.00 per beer is fair considering you can listen to this wonderful music. This is S.F.- high rents, and taxes, and proprietors have to
make some profit!  It's a pretty huge place and gets packed during
the performance. There is also pool tables in the back. No waitress
service, no food. It would be nice if they would sell some munchies
along with the drinks to help keep sober.  We would come back, but
only for the entertainment which is well-worth the trip here. It's fun
to watch the faces of people and children walking by and smiling
and stopping to hear the great dixieland music.  Kids love it, but
can't come in because it is only a bar.  We recommend this
place on a Saturday highly. Would give this place a 5, but feel the
place needs some sort of food to go with the drinks. We give
the band a 10!!!!
author: Girly Foodie F.

description: Three stars are because that's the average already. I have nothing bad to say about the bar itself, don't know enough about it, actually had a good time there last year one late afternoon, but I went in there last Saturday night, and the frat-boy sorority-girl scene was horrendous! Was this the infamous "Marina scene" people talk about? Old Abe's been around, seen the inside of many pubs in my day; clubs, bars, you name it, but never have I seen such snobbery in my life! So it was crowded, and I made my way towards the bathroom in the back, "excuse me" and excusing myself along the way, and NOT ONE person, male or female, budged and inch. I even got dirty looks from people. I'm actually standing there, saying excuse me, some chick snubs her nose at me, doesn't even bother to FAKE a shuffle. And this happens with every single person I say excuse me to, about 9 or 10, on the way to the loo. Seriously, these are the people who give SF--America I should say--a bad name. If you're feeling bold and curious, or are majoring in psychology, go in there on a Saturday just for research.
author: Boom Z.

description: okay its very hard to give this place a review.  on one hand, there is the fact that i have been going here for YEARS and my friends go, and we know the bartenders, and i like the outside seating, and its spacious, they have pool if thats your thing, and i almost always have a good time there.  but on the other hand, it can get verrrry crowded, and the bathrooms get super-gross, and if you dont like smoking dont sit outside, so i had to dock 1 star for those reasons.  but i have to say - as a NB resident, i consider it a staple of the neighborhood!
author: Carolyn B.

description: this place is great. always a good, chill time. the drinks are reasonable, and the crowd is always fun. i never played so many random, friendly games of pool with complete strangers in any other venue. definitely recommended for a great, chill time. awesome place to grab a table with some friends and just hang out.
author: Jon N.

description: This place has good atmosphere, with plenty of seating. You can have a conversation with someone special or bring a group of twenty some odd people and get rowdy. be careful though, this place can blow up or resemble a funeral depending on what night of the week you go (sometime it just depends on what time you go too.) The patio is nice on most evenings plus its heated. The bottom line is that there are plenty of places in the City that are far worse and this is one of the better spots just to hang out. If you want to meet girls you don't already know then i suggest a place that's a little more clubby. The drinks suck though which is why it gets the three stars. Most times the drinks are small and contain very little alcohol. If you can stomach it, order a Knob Creek or a Crown Royal on the rocks and just beat the system that way. The pool tables and fussball are good time killers as well. Just be sure you know the names of the girls playing your buddies in fussball before engaging in a game of grab ass. Hey, we all make mistakes. In the end, I will actually go to this place willingly which more than I can say for most City bars.
author: Ryan M.

description: i'm surprised at the negative reviews b/c i love this place.  i haven't seen so many hott guys in one place in a loooooooong time!  and really, what else do you need?  ;p
author: N L.

description: casual with an open air patio and some pool/billiard tables.  perfect for hanging out but they only take cash!!  and i rarely have more than $5 cash on me at any moment in time, which might be enough to buy 1 beer.  and 1 beer is not enough...
author: Jenny Q.

description: go on a weeknight.   thursday night is good after work.  weekends are too packed, despite the fact that the place is huge.  i went last night for a going away party for a co-worker.  we were pretty much the only people there and we had a great time.  the indoor/outdoor part is cruical because you can smoke on the spacious heat-lamped patio and keep drinking at the same time....not that i'm a smoker, because i'm not....really, i swear!  super nice bartender too.  the only drawback is it's CASH ONLY!
author: Cyn B.

description: I've always liked this bar for the semi-outdoor patio seating.  However, I went two weekends ago with my brother, his wife, and my boyfriend.  My boyfriend forgot his id and the bartender did not allow him to even hang out in the bar.  Dude, there are only two other people here, can you not remember that my boyfriend isn't drinking?  The same bartender had a hissy over someone who was smoking on the sidewalk and the wind blew his smoke into the patio area (barely).  This guy needs to chill.  I bet he also goes in the bathroom while guys are peeing to make sure they don't spray on the seats.
author: LT B.

description: It's usually crowded, smoke filled and not easy to get a drink. I stop by if I have to but definately enjoy it most on off nights when i can relax on the patio.
author: Evan S.

description: Cool spot. My smoker buddies love the smoking area and I love all the pool tables. although nobody loves the $4 Bud Lights we always get. Oh and they don't accept credit cards (which most nights ends up being a blessing in disguise if you know what I mean - don't act as wild around the young ladies.
author: Mike S.
